metadata.name: File Encryption/Decryption Via Gpg4win From Suspicious Locations
metadata.comment: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\gpg.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\gpg2.exe'))) AND lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('gnu privacy guard (gnupg)') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('gnupg’s openpgp tool') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-passphrase')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\perflogs\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\users\\public\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\roaming\\'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.
